Detailed Description

Struct to assist getting/setting Free-form Warning/Error Message Field.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

vrt::FreeFormMessage::FreeFormMessage (  )  [inline]

Default constructor for empty Free-form Warning/Error message.

vrt::FreeFormMessage::FreeFormMessage ( const std::string  msg  )  [inline]

Constructor that accepts a Free-form Warning/Error message as a string.

The string message is stored as a null-terminated byte-buffer. The size of the resulting byte-buffer is one byte more than the number of characters in the input message string.

Parameters:
msg Message string
vrt::FreeFormMessage::FreeFormMessage ( const char *  msg,
const size_t  len 
) [inline]

Constructor that accepts a Free-form Warning/Error message as a byte- buffer.

A null-terminator is NOT added to the byte sequence. If null- termination is desired, it must be included in the input byte-buffer. The size of the resulting byte-buffer is equal to the size of input message byte-buffer.

Parameters:
msg Message byte-buffer
len Size of byte-buffer

Member Function Documentation

const char* vrt::FreeFormMessage::buffer (  )  const [inline]

Gets a const pointer to the first byte of the Free-form Warning/Error message byte-buffer.

This is intended as a read-only pointer that must be used in conjunction with size() method. Use one of the setMessage() methods to set or modify the message. Warning: the pointer is not guaranteed to be valid, and may in fact become invalid if either setMessage() method is called afterward. Use with caution.

Returns:
Message byte-buffer pointer
bool vrt::FreeFormMessage::empty (  )  const [inline]

Is Free-form Warning/Error message empty/blank?

Returns:
True if message is empty; False otherwise.
void vrt::FreeFormMessage::setMessage ( const char *  msg,
const size_t  len 
) [inline]

Sets Free-form Warning/Error message from a byte-buffer.

A null- terminator is NOT added to the byte sequence. If null-termination is desired, it must be included in the input byte-buffer. The size of the resulting byte-buffer is equal to the size of input message byte-buffer.

Parameters:
msg Message byte-buffer
len Size of byte-buffer
void vrt::FreeFormMessage::setMessage ( const std::string  msg  )  [inline]

Sets Free-form Warning/Error message from a string.

The string message is stored as a null-terminated byte-buffer. The size of the resulting byte-buffer is one byte more than the number of characters in the input message string.

Parameters:
msg Message string
size_t vrt::FreeFormMessage::size (  )  const [inline]

Gets size of Free-form Warning/Error message.

Returns:
Size of message (byte-buffer)
std::string vrt::FreeFormMessage::text (  )  const [inline]

Gets the string representation of the Free-form Warning/Error message.

A message with a null-terminator as the last byte will not include the null-terminator in the string representation (i.e. the length of the string will be one less than the size of the message byte-buffer). Otherwise, the size of the string will be equal to the size of the byte- buffer. An empty message results in an empty string.

Returns:
String representation of the message
